legal_requirement: Law No. 11-03 "on the protection and development of the environment"
description: Establishes the basic rules and general principles of national policy in the field of environmental protection and development.
comments: The law 11-03 is applicable to this project. In fact, this law sets the general framework of environmental protection and deals with various areas, including liquid discharges, waste, fauna, and flora of the project at all phases.

legal_requirement: Framework Law No. 99-12 "on the National Charter for the Environment and Sustainable Development"
description: Defines the principals to a sustainable development strategy.

legal_requirement: Law No. 12-03 " on environmental impact studies"
description: Provides and lists the projects subject, the procedure of implementation and consistency of impact studies.
task: Review the list of projects subject to an ESIA and determine if chemical additives plant project requires one
comments: The chemical additives plant project is classified under the chemical industry section. Therefore, the project is a subject to an ESIA in order to obtain the environmental acceptability and the construction permission, which will be conducted by JESA.

legal_requirement: Decree No. 2-04-563 "on the responsibilities and functions of the national and regional environmental impact studies committees"
description: Defines attributions and functioning of the national and regional committees of environmental impact studies.

legal_requirement: Decree No. 2-04-564 "setting the terms and conditions of the organization and conduct of the public inquiry relating to projects subject to environmental impact studies"
description: Sets out the terms and conditions for the organization and conduct of the public inquiry on projects subject to ESIA.
task: Launch the public inquiry procedure for the project, in accordance with the provisions of Decree No. 2-04-564

legal_requirement: Law No. 49-17 "on environmental assessment"
description: Aims to subject public policies, programs, strategies and sectorial and regional development plans, as well as projects that may have an impact on the environment, to a strategic environmental assessment.

legal_requirement: Law No. 47-18 "on the reform of regional investment centers (CRI) and the creation of unified regional investment commissions (CRUI)"
description: Defines the roles and responsibilites of CRI and CRUI.
task: Submit the project file will be done through the platform of the CRI concerned by the project

legal_requirement: IFC Environmental and Social Performance Standards
description: Define the responsibilities of project owners for managing environmental and social risks.
comments: The project should adhere to IFC standards for ESIA development and IFC's sustainability policy.

legal_requirement: Implementation of systematic environmental measures - July 27, 2021
description: Generalize and systematize the application of certain good practices and environmental measures in order to consolidate the position of OCP Group as a leader in the field of Sustainable Development
task: Consider the ESIA, air emissions and liquid effluents release limits, sanitary wastewater and rainwater management, waste management and sorting areas, and noise management.

legal_requirement: Law No. 28-00 "on waste management and disposal"
description: Defines the different types of waste, specifies their management methods and the level of their management. It also introduces the concept of hazardous waste and the management of this type of waste by making it subject to a system of prior authorization at all stages of management: collection, transport, storage and disposal.
task: Implement a waste management plan for the project
comments: OCP Group has a "Waste Management referential " which determines the waste prevention and management requirements set by OCP Group, based mainly on the regulations in force and good practices. This reference framework is applicable to all OCP Group entities (operational and functional, including joint ventures); A waste management plan will be developed by Environmental team in the define phase.

legal_requirement: Law No. 23-12 amending law No. 28-00 relating to waste management and disposal
description: Repeals and replaces the article 42 of the law No. 28-00 as follows: "The import of hazardous waste is prohibited. "

legal_requirement: Decree No. 2-14-85 "on the management of hazardous waste"
description: Establish organizational measures for the management of hazardous waste.
task: Propose appropriate methods for managing hazardous waste
comments: The Group OCP has already implemented an auxiliary products management standard, the project must aligne with this reference as mentioned above.

legal_requirement: Order No. 3184-15 " for the application of articles 5, 6, 7 and 11 of Decree No. 2- 14-85"
description: Sets the model of the register kept by generators, holders, collectors-transporters and operators of hazardous waste storage or treatment facilities, the model of the annual report and the model of the internal hazardous waste management plan.
task: Follow the waste disposal process through a waste tracking form

description: Fixes the administrative procedures and technical requirementes applies to controlled landfills of classes 1, 2 and 3 referred to in Article 48 of Law No. 28-00 on waste management and disposal.
task: Follow the administrative procedures & comply with the requirements relating to controlled land fills

legal_requirement: Law No. 77-15 "Prohibiting the manufacturing, import, export, marketing and use of plastic bags"

description: Establishes the technical requirements that must be taken into account in the development and operation of waste incineration facilities for disposal; as well as the conditions and requirements to be met by facilities that recover waste through incineration.

legal_requirement: Decree 2-09-139 " on the management of medical and pharmaceutical waste "

comments: The Group OCP has already implemented an auxiliary products management standard, the project must aligne with this reference.

legal_requirement: Auxilary Products Management - S-HSE-ENV-01 - Edition 2.0 - April 22, 2021

legal_requirement: Decree No. 2-04-553 "relative to spills, flows, discharges, direct or indirect deposits in surface or ground waters"

responsibility: Client Environmental engineer Process engineer Civil engineer Contractor

legal_requirement: IFC - General Environmental, Health and Safety Guidelines "Water Conservation"
description: Sets the EHS guidelines for Phosphate Fertilizer Production which aim to minimize the environmental and health risks associated with the production of phosphate fertilizers. The guidelines cover various aspects of the manufacturing process, including Wastewater.

legal_requirement: Environmental, Health and Safety Guidelines for Large Volume Inorganic Compounds Manufacturing and Coal Tar Distillation

task: The project must comply with the requirements and limit values set by the Environmental, Health and Safety Guidelines for Large Volume Inorganic Compounds Manufacturing and Coal Tar Distillation

legal_requirement: S-HSE-ENV-03-Appendix 3 Note OIR n° 09-21 Implementing Systematic Environmental Measures
description: Provides a List of best practices and environmental measures to be systematized at operational site
task: -Sanitary wastewater must be separated and treated in a WWTP or connected to a public sewerage system. The use of septic tanks is tolerated only during the construction phase of the project and only after formal approval from the entity in charge of the Environment and/or HSE of the site concerned. -Rainwater must be separated and recycled. -Each OCP operational site must carry out an annual representative characterization campaign of its liquid effluents by a competent third party. -Each OCP operational site must carry out an annual representative campaign by a competent third party to characterize the quality of the groundwater in the area in which it operates (in particular at the level of surrounding wells).
responsibility: Client Environmental engineer Civil engineer HSE Engineer Process engineer

IFC General Environmental, Health and Safety Guidelines - " Noise Management"

legal_requirement: Law No. 13-03 " on the fight against air pollution"

It forbids releasing, emitting or discharging pollutants into the air such as toxic or corrosive gases, fumes, steam, heat, dust, odours beyond the allowed amount or concentration by Moroccan regulations and standards.

legal_requirement: Decree No. 2-09-631 "setting limit values for release, emission or discharge of pollutants into the air from fixed pollution sources and procedures for their control"

legal_requirement: Decree No. 2-09-286 "fixing the air quality standards and the installation methods of the monitoring networks "
description: 20 Hija 1430 / 08 December 2009 | Sets air quality standards and the procedures for setting up monitoring networks.

comments: According to this regulation : -The maximum concentration of Particulate Matter [PM10] in ambient air must be less than 50 μg/m3 for a period of 24h (90.4th percentile value). -The maximum concentration of Particulate Matter [PM2.5] in ambient air must be less than 45 μg/m3 for a period of 24h. For other characteristic pollutants and other periods : refer to Environmental design Criteria

legal_requirement: Decree No. 2-23-244 "Modifying and completing decree No. 2-09-286 and setting the standards of air quality and defining the modalities of implementation of air quality monitoring networks".
description: 26 Chaaban 1445/ 07 Mar 2024 | This Decree modifies and completes the Decree No. 2.09.286, with the aim of adding certain definitions, updating the list of pollutants and air quality standards, and to modify certain provisions related to improving the governance of the management of the air quality surveillance and monitoring network in Morocco.
task: Air emissions from the project must be treated prior to release to the air in order to comply with air quality standards

legal_requirement: WHO "air quality guidelines"
description: 2021 | Reflects the availability of new evidence on the health effects of these pollutants and their relative importance with regard to current and future health effects of air pollution in each of the WHO regions.

comments: According to the edition "2021" of this guideline : - The maximum concentration of Particulate Matter 10 [PM10] in ambient air must be less than 45 μg/m3 for a period of 24h (99th percentile value). - The maximum concentration of Particulate Matter 2.5 [PM2.5] in ambient air must be less than 15 μg/m3 for a period of 24h (99th percentile value). -The maximum concentration of N02 in ambient air must be less than 200 μg/m3 for a period of 1h (99th percentile).
